title: IHC and RIQ Strategic 10-year Reinsurance Partnership
description: IHC and RIQ have announced a strategic 10-year alliance targeting over USD 500 million in reinsurance premiums. RIQ, an AI-native reinsurance platform launched by IHC in partnership with BlackRock and Lunate, will deliver AI-powered risk transfer solutions tailored to IHC and its group companies. The partnership aims to enhance resilience and operational agility across IHC's portfolio, accelerate Abu Dhabi's rise as a global reinsurance hub, and leverage advanced data modeling and AI-augmented underwriting across Specialty and Property & Casualty risk classes. The collaboration is subject to regulatory clearance from the Financial Services Regulatory Authority of ADGM.
source_name: IHC and RIQ Announce Strategic 10-year Alliance Anchored by Over USD 500 Million in Reinsurance Premiums

opportunities.title: AI Model Providers Licensing to RIQ Platform
opportunities.description: Specialized AI companies developing risk assessment, actuarial, or catastrophe modeling algorithms can partner to license or integrate their advanced models into the RIQ platform. This enables RIQ to expand the breadth and depth of its AI-powered risk transfer solutions, allowing for more accurate underwriting across a wider set of risk classes. Given the emphasis on AI-native solutions and constant need for model enhancement, this is both realistic and commercially valuable.
roadmap_steps: Identify specific AI/ML model gaps in RIQ’s platform or areas for improvement
Research and approach RIQ/BlackRock/Lunate tech teams with tailored partnership proposals
Demonstrate value by showing case studies or pilot results in insurance modeling
Establish licensing or integration terms subject to RIQ’s platform requirements
Navigate regulatory approvals with RIQ where model use affects compliance

opportunities.title: Data Providers Enable RIQ Underwriting Enrichment
opportunities.description: Firms offering comprehensive alternative risk, environmental, or market data (including geospatial, ESG, or IoT-based datasets) can work with RIQ to enrich its data pool for more robust risk modeling and underwriting. Since advanced data is crucial for AI-based reinsurance, sourcing diverse data can significantly boost the platform’s performance and accuracy.
roadmap_steps: Map out specific data needs of RIQ’s underwriting team (e.g., catastrophe, cyber, ESG, climate)
Prepare data sample sets and technical documentation
Engage RIQ’s data strategy contacts for integration pilots
Negotiate commercial terms and technical data feeds
Collaborate on fine-tuning data for compliance and insurance applications

opportunities.title: Third-party Specialty Risk MGA Integration
opportunities.description: Managing General Agents (MGAs) specializing in unique or hard-to-place specialty risk can seek to distribute their products or capacity through the RIQ platform. This partnership would flow more specialty risk into the Abu Dhabi-centered hub and, in turn, benefit from RIQ’s AI underwriting and data-driven approach.
roadmap_steps: Identify alignment between MGA risk appetite and RIQ/Abu Dhabi reinsurance focus
Contact RIQ business development to discuss product distribution or co-underwriting
Provide due diligence on MGA’s track record and risk portfolio
Pilot integration for digital quoting, underwriting and policy issuance
Ensure regulatory alignment for cross-border risk transfer

opportunities.title: Insurance Consulting Firms Advising on Regulatory and AI Implementation
opportunities.description: Consultancies specializing in insurance regulation and AI implementation can assist RIQ in meeting the Financial Services Regulatory Authority of ADGM's requirements and ensure smooth onboarding of new AI systems. By acting as advisors, these firms can streamline RIQ’s expansion and compliance efforts.
roadmap_steps: Analyze ADGM’s regulatory landscape and RIQ’s projected operational model
Create a compliance and implementation roadmap for AI integration
Pitch regulatory solution packages to RIQ’s legal/compliance teams
Provide ongoing consulting as RIQ launches new lines or enters new geographies
Offer staff training on best practices for regulatory AI adoption

opportunities.title: Cloud Infrastructure Providers for Scalable Reinsurance Operations
opportunities.description: Cloud providers offering secure, scalable hosting can collaborate to power RIQ’s AI and data-intensive operations, ensuring robust uptime, compliance with financial industry standards, and global reach for cross-border reinsurance activities.
roadmap_steps: Audit RIQ platform’s current cloud architecture and scaling needs
Design a tailored, compliant cloud solution for high-load AI processing
Engage RIQ’s IT leadership on proof-of-concept or migration plans
Align service-level agreements with risk and regulatory requirements
Provide ongoing support and innovation for evolving reinsurance demands
